questions.text: What was the last line Coach spoke?
questions.correct: "In some ways he can see more."
questions.explanation:
"In some ways he can see more."

	Nicholas Colasanto died on February 12, 1985. Consequently, they moved this opening to the last episode and covered for his death in other ways throughout the season. One way they did this was to say that he was off visiting family.

questions.text: What did Cliff do on the phone that made a woman not want to go out with him?
questions.correct: pretended it was an obscene phone call
questions.explanation:
pretended it was an obscene phone call.

	Cliff was never good with women. Once again, he struck out this time because he thought it would be funny to make it sound like he was an obscene caller when he called a girl Norm knew.

he died.

	Luigi was the chef at the restaurant in Italy where Frasier and Diane ate... or attempted to eat. The staff was so upset they couldn't function so they never ended up eating.

questions.text: Who got engaged in this episode?
questions.explanation:
Frasier and Diane.

	Frasier proposed to Diane while they were in Italy. The plan was for them to get married while they were still in Europe.

an answering machine.

	Sam got the answering machine for his office so he wouldn't miss his personal calls. Carla at one point told the others not to pick up because it was his personal line and the machine would get it. Sam said it was a deluxe model, "top of the line".

questions.text: When was the wedding scheduled (in relation to the events in the episode)?
questions.explanation:
tomorrow.

	They were planning to marry rather quickly because they thought it would be more romantic to marry in Italy. They left it open as to whether or not the wedding actually took place.

questions.text: Who was really happy about the couple getting married?
questions.explanation:
Carla.

	Carla figured with Diane getting married, she would never see her again. She figured this way Sam would never see Diane again either, which meant they wouldn't end up together.

questions.text: Who did Sam have a daydream about?
questions.explanation:
Diane.

	Sam dreamt that he stopped Frasier and Diane's wedding. We could see from his dream that he still had feelings for Diane.

Florence.

	Florence is a city in Italy. It was where Diane and Frasier were supposed to get married. Carla was not too happy about this because she thought Sam should not be with Diane.

questions.text: Who did Diane call before the wedding?
questions.explanation:
Sam.

	She got his answering machine on which he said, "This is Sam..." He then went on to explain that it was really a machine, but she didn't wait that long. She assumed Sam was at the bar while she hoped Sam would be coming to stop the wedding.
